title: Shipfinex FZCO Secures In-Principle Approval from VARA for Virtual Asset Broker-Dealer License
summary: Shipfinex's VARA approval in Dubai will tokenize vessel assets using blockchain. This venture presents an opportunity for investors to fractionally own ships, but also introduces new regulatory risks. We remain skeptical of the environmental impact of democratizing ship ownership, especially with the potential for increased utilization of older, less efficient vessels.
content:
Shipfinex FZCO (https://www.shipfinex.com/) has received In-Principle Approval (IPA) from Dubai’s Virtual Assets Regulatory Authority (VARA) for a Broker-Dealer license.

This milestone validates Shipfinex’s operational framework, confirming it has met VARA’s rigorous requirements regarding compliance, governance, and security. It marks a significant step in establishing a compliant infrastructure for the global maritime industry.

A Regulated Platform for Shipping Finance

Shipfinex utilizes Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT) to tokenize maritime assets, creating a trusted bridge between ship owners and a broader customer base.

For Ship Owners: The platform provides an alternative liquidity channel to tokenize vessel ownership and raise capital efficiently while maintaining operational control.

For Investors: The platform offers regulated access to fractional ownership in ships, enabling participation in an asset class previously inaccessible due to high capital thresholds.

Commitment to Regulatory Standards “Securing this In-Principle Approval is a foundational step in our roadmap to modernize shipping finance,” said Capt. Vikas Pandey, Founder & CEO. “To truly democratize the industry, trust is paramount. Aligning with VARA’s robust regulatory framework ensures a secure, transparent, and compliant environment for all participants.”

“Shipping requires constant reinvestment. As traditional funding retreats, we must embrace compliant financial pathways,” added Mr. Vivek Seth, Chairman. “Shipfinex respects operational realities while solving liquidity challenges with the governance owners expect.”

Mr. Dipak Karki, CFO, stated: “This is evolutionary progress for ship finance, impacting both debt and equity. It allows the exchange to be an efficient, transparent platform for individuals and institutions to share economic ownership of a vessel.”

Next Steps

Shipfinex FZCO will now proceed to satisfy the remaining conditions required to secure the full Virtual Asset Service Provider (VASP) license. The platform offers customers a seamless, regulated environment to own fractional ownership in ships, with complete security, transparency and professional governance.
